message: Some greasemonkey scripts are really fat. They end up in one rule emit << >> and that means browser can't cache them and KNS probably does some "processing" each time the rule gets fired which is completely unnecessary because an imported greasemonkey doesn't put anything in preludes.
So once a greasemonkey script is working with kynetx it's recommended to put the code in a external js file and import it with "use javascript resource js_url"
I hope that one day a "kynetx app" will be a package including resources ( js , images , css ...) that can be deployed in a single process.
will this work in KBX ? suspense....
will the included js be available anywhere ? suspense again...
Oh my goodness ! KOBJ.registerExternalResources works if I put it in a global emit << >>
it also works inside the emit of a rule
calling it from a rule will not have the same properties.
that method is what is called with a use resource call. It is called before the rule closures, and that is how we guarentee that it is loaded before any actions run.
